context.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
context.content: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn and make decisions from data without being explicitly programmed for every task. It involves algorithms that can identify patterns in data and make predictions or classifications based on those patterns.

context.title: Types of Machine Learning
context.content: There are three main types of machine learning: supervised learning (learning from labeled examples), unsupervised learning (finding patterns in unlabeled data), and reinforcement learning (learning through trial and error with rewards).

medical_test.query: What are the symptoms of diabetes?

context.title: Diabetes Symptoms
context.content: Common symptoms of diabetes include increased thirst, frequent urination, unexplained weight loss, increased hunger, blurred vision, slow-healing sores, and frequent infections. Type 1 diabetes symptoms often develop quickly, while Type 2 symptoms may develop gradually.

context.title: Diabetes Complications
context.content: If left untreated, diabetes can lead to serious complications including cardiovascular disease, nerve damage, kidney damage, eye damage, foot damage, and increased risk of infections.

comparison_test.query: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of cloud computing vs on-premises infrastructure

context.title: Cloud Computing Benefits
context.content: Cloud computing offers scalability, cost-effectiveness, automatic updates, disaster recovery, and remote accessibility. Organizations can quickly scale resources up or down based on demand and pay only for what they use.

context.title: On-Premises Infrastructure
context.content: On-premises infrastructure provides complete control over data and systems, enhanced security for sensitive information, customization capabilities, and no ongoing subscription costs. However, it requires significant upfront investment and ongoing maintenance.

context.title: Neural Networks Basics
context.content: A neural network is a computing system inspired by biological neural networks. It consists of interconnected nodes (neurons) that process information. Each connection has a weight that adjusts as learning proceeds, enabling the network to recognize patterns and make predictions.
